alert.note: Alert for Bering Strait Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Interior Seward Peninsula; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 14 at 2:36PM AKST until January 16 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 3 PM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected with blizzard conditions and brief freezing rain possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. Visibility one quarter mile or less at times. * WHERE...Bering Strait Coast, Southern Seward Peninsula Coast, Interior Seward Peninsula and Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 3 PM AKST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause extensive damage and power lines.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning means significant amounts of snow, sleet and ice are expected or occurring. This will make travel very difficult or impossible.

area.areaDesc: Bering Strait Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Interior Seward Peninsula; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast
